quesDetails:
I downloaded this component and imported into my Visualizer Enterprise 8 SP2 FP20 today. I created a new project in Kony Reference Architecture and created a new form "Form1". I drag and dropped the skeletonscreen component on the form. I didn't change anything in the property pane and there is no any other widget on the form.
I run this app and tested it on Visualizer Preview on my iPhone Xs Max. The preview app shows a complete white screen without any movement. I also tested it on Visualizer Preview on my Nexus 5X android phone and got the same result. I built it and run on xcode on my iPhone and the result is the same. 
Could you help me to find out what's wrong?

name: Deni E Santoso (self employed)
quesTitle: How to add another application name to Kony ?
quesDetails:
Hi,
 
I wanna ask question about some trouble when integrating FFI to Kony. My FFI already have application name
 
("android:name = "com.myapps.MobileVideoApplication"")
 
written in its manifest.
 
When i integrate it to Kony and build it, console return me with error and force me to use "tools:replace="android:name" in attempt to override "android:name" in my FFI with "android:name" of Kony
 
(i believe it is com.konylabs.android.KonyApplication, thought).
 
in this case, i've tried 2 options, both options is successfully built the apps but fail to works as i want.
 
First, i try to override it with "tools:replace="android:name" and "android:name="com.myapps.MobileVideoApplication". This options leads to apps cannot start and didn't even showing logcat in android.
 
Second, i delete "android:name = "com.myapps.MobileVideoApplication"" from my FFI manifest, so when it built in Kony, it didn't force me to override application name. But when i run the FFI, it return me with this error.
 
 java.lang.RuntimeException: Unable to start activity ComponentInfo{com.orgname.copytext/com.myapss.mobilevideo.LoginActivity}: java.lang.ClassCastException: com.konylabs.android.KonyApplication cannot be cast to com.myapps.mobilevideo.MobileVideoApplication
I hope there is a way to solve this. Thank you for any hints and help.

name: Aparna Amalladinne (USFoods)
quesTitle: Access Camera flash light
quesDetails:
We are using a market place component - Continuous barcode scanner, the version 1.0.
We would like to check if there is a possibility of turning on the camera flash while scanning.
When trying to scan in less light, the component fails to capture the barcode. Having the ability to switch the camera flash on will be very handy in such situations.
If the current component doesn't support, we would like to understand if there is any further release that may get the functionality implemented.

name: Thomas Mendorf (Henkel AG & Co. KGaA)
quesTitle: How to get Desktop web app working for SAML identity provider?
quesDetails:
Hi, 
I had to change frmLoginController for Responsive web/Desktop as follows

line 28
var sdkInstance = new kony.sdk.getCurrentInstance();
changed to
var sdkInstance = new kony.sdk.getDefaultInstance();

since otherwise, the sdkInstance would be (null) (getCurrentInstance() is deprecated)

then, on line 30
var userStoreAuth = sdkInstance.getIdentityService("myIdentityProvider");
instead of userstore.

However, after building the web app, and trying to log in, following error message occurs:

{
"details": {
"message": "Invalid Identity Provider found in Request",
"errcode": 0,
"errmsg": "Invalid Identity Provider found in Request"
},
"httpstatus": "Unauthorized",
"requestid": "6576dbef-a309-4564-b2d9-9dca40bb95dc",
"domain": "AUTH",
"code": -7,
"mfcode": "Auth-7",
"message": "Invalid Provider"
}

after the Submit button is pressed on the login form.
The request is done to "https://1000xxxxx.auth.konycloud.com/login?provider=myIdentityProvider" but the IDP is actually a SAML service, and URL should be requested as 
"https://1000xxxxx.auth.konycloud.com/saml/login?provider=myIdentityProvider" (missing "/saml" in the URL)

How can I get this working to request SAML authentication on the web app? 

Thanks
